alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:51AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Knox, Martin, southeastern Greene, southern Lawrence and Daviess Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1250 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Bedford to 11 miles northwest of Shoals to 6 miles southeast of St. Francisville. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. The strong winds are along an outflow that will precede the heavy rain...perhaps by as much as 10 to 15 minutes. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bedford and Washington around 1255 AM EDT. Shoals around 100 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for south central and southwestern Indiana.
